@Kam agreed, Misfits is the best show I've seen in a long time.

My wife and I are trying to like _Deadwood_, but it's pretty forced thus far (just finished episode three). I was hoping for something a little emptier, a little more about the desperation between camps and towns. Maybe it's an unfair expectation; I kinda want the sparse, dangerous interstices of _Fallout_, not a soap opera. Curiously, though, I very much liked _Jericho_ and am still into _BSG_, and they don't lack for melodrama.

@muraii really, give it a chance. This is probably the best western show ever.

Check out "The Cape". It's a brand new (only about 5 episodes in) comic book themed show. The writing is a little cheesy at times (as many comic book themed productions are) but it's a pretty interesting storyline.
@cadessi Thanks for the tip.

@muraii I completely agree on Battlestar Galactica. I've been meaning to re-watch the series since I own it on DVD, but I just don't know where I'll get the time to watch that much material. I also wanted to see more Deadwood. I saw random episodes of it here and there when a friend was renting the DVDs from Netflix. I didn't really get much of the whole, but I thought it had enough promise to make it worth watching.
